intro: Pentas zanzibarica subsp. zanzibarica, commonly known as Zanzibar pentas, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical gardens.
